medical_history.chief_complaint: Weakness in limbs and worsening back pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing midthoracic back pain, hip flexor weakness, and numbness of the first finger of her right hand three months prior to presentation. Over the next two months, symptoms progressed to numbness and weakness in her right arm, weakness in her left arm and leg, diplopia, and facial weakness. The back pain worsened along with sharp, shooting, and burning pain in her limbs.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Celiac disease and dermatitis herpetiformis, adhering to a gluten-free diet, with no active skin or gastrointestinal manifestations.
medical_history.social_history: Works as a dance instructor, lives with her husband and daughter, does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use recreational drugs.
